topics: Lives in Novo Hamburgo, RS, Brazil
profile.personalDescription:
Self-taught kid. As many programmers, I started learning HTML, then CSS, JavaScript and PHP by myself as a kid, about 9 years old.

I have made a few freelancing jobs at this time, but after high-school, I somehow go to study business administration. That's actually my bachelor degree, something I still like, not as much as programming though.

I have been in an exchange to Ireland for a year, and one of the things I miss the most is communicating in English.

I also can communicate in Portuguese (of course, it is my mother tongue), Spanish and a very little Danish.

I guess at this point you probably have already noticed that I'm very interested in programming. So I would like to point out my profile as a developer.
profile.developerDescription:
As a developer I am on of those guys that might still lack a bit of knowledge, but I like to study a lot, and I am sure I will catch on to any need.

Furthermore, I am very concerned about the quality of the code, to me, the most important parts of coding is to keep a clean code and with a consistent style guide. I believe this way I can see my improvement and won't lose much time searching pieces of the code or trying to figure out what happened there.

experiences.description: I make mobile apps using React Native; And Full-stack Web Development using UI libraries like Vue.js and React.js, many times jQuery or just VanillaJS based on the project; On the back-end side I have done some testings with Node.js, but I have used only PHP in production so far.

I was working most of the time working on the front-end of this platform, although I did a few changes on the back-end also.

In this company, I wrote a lot of code in VanillaJS and also jQuery. We used there an MVC approach with (PHP) CodeIgniter framework.

Here is also where I learned a lot of things like Git, Gulp, Web Services, SCSS, React, React Native, CSS methodologies, JavaScripts Standards.
Not very relevant, except that it proves I can communicate at work in English.

Unfurtunetally I don't have a record of this time, I'm pretty sure was about it.
I found a record of this website from 2007, I still think it was a pretty decent code for that time.
